configuration.name: mc-item-022398373670876026
configuration.stem: Explore these maps to see the relationship between surface winds and surface currents.

options.name: mc-opt-item-028151441155932844
options.label: Surface Winds
options.imageAlt: In this map,  surface winds are shown. For the most part, winds at the same latitudes move in the same direction, with winds near the poles moving from west to east and winds near the equator moving from east to west.

options.name: mc-opt-item-06761015402153134x1
options.label: Surface Currents
options.imageAlt: In this map, ocean currents are shown. Warm currents tend to originate near the equator, while cool currents tend to originate near the polar regions. Some currents change direction as they approach land.

options.name: LII-06787310173454411
options.label: Surface Winds and Surface Currents
options.imageAlt: In this map, the relationship between ocean currents and surface winds are shown. The currents and surface winds flow in the same direction.
